result.execSummary:
The defendant Holly A. Mertens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Court directs payments in the amount of $25.00 per month commencing January 1, 2016 and each month until paid in full. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with D. Boileau as named in the complaint.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Holly A. Mertens

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from DOC - DE has paid the restitution in full - PRH to be removed from the calendar
Probation review hearing on November 29, 2016 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 9:40 am case called. Defendant Holly A. Mertens in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on record by ADA Anderson. Attorney Goldin concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 60 days WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 1 year. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No credit for time served. CONDITIONS: $285.00 Restitution to be paid in the amount of $25.00 per month commencing January 1, 2016 and each month until paid in full, Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Terms of Agent. No Contact with D. Boileau.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Goldin requests plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 2:35 PM: Defendant Holly A. Mertens in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel.  As Def is not employed, Def referred to SPD for eligibility.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 03:10 pm.
Restitution Summary and Statement of Loss/Damage - $285.00
